title: Set global site background to pure white

requirements.summary: Ensure the global background theme tokens and base page background styles render pure white everywhere (including behind/around all sections and outside content).
acceptanceCriteria: When viewing the site at any scroll position, the page background renders as plain white with no orange background visible behind/around sections.
The global background token used by Tailwind classes (e.g., `bg-background`) corresponds to pure white in light mode.
The `body` (and, if necessary, `html`/`#root`) background is explicitly styled to white so that any empty space/margins outside components do not show orange.

file_operations.description: Harden global base styling so the true page canvas is always white in light mode: keep `--background` as pure white (`1 0 0`) and explicitly set `html`, `body`, and `#root` background to white (and ensure full-height behavior) to prevent any orange bleed-through in gaps/outside sections.

Align any alternate/global Tailwind base stylesheet with the same pure-white background behavior: ensure light-mode `--background` remains pure white and add/confirm explicit `html`, `body`, and `#root` white background styling so the rendered page background cannot fall back to an orange default.
